jazyjason

The International Gay and Lesbian Human Rights Commission writes: "The following is a translation of a story from Alarabiya, a UAE-based media network, which was published on its Arabic website a few hours ago. While IGLHRC has not verified all of the allegations, many are consistent with patterns of human rights violations being reported from within the country."
 
 The translation:
 
 "A prominent Iraqi human rights activist says that Iraqi militia have deployed a painful form of torture against homosexuals by closing their anuses using 'Iranian gum.' ... Yina Mohammad told Alarabiya.net that, 'Iraqi militias have deployed an unprecedented form of torture against homosexuals by using a very strong glue that will close their anus.' According to her, the new substance 'is known as the American hum, which is an Iranian-manufactured glue that if applied to the skin, sticks to it and can only be removed by surgery. After they glue the anuses of homosexuals, they give them a drink that causes diarrhea. Since the anus is closed, the diarrhea causes death. Videos of this form of torture are being distributed on mobile cellphones in Iraq.' According to this human rights activist, for the past 3 weeks a crackdown on homosexuals has been going on based on a religious decree that demands their death; dozens have been targeted. She says that the persecution of homosexuals is not confined to the Shiite clerics. Some Sunni leaders have also declared the death penalty for sodomy on satellite channels." 
 
 Report: Iraqi Militia Killing Gay Men with Painful Anal Glue Torture - Towleroad, More than gay news. More gay men

I say bull shite to that - they don't have to change their beliefs or accept us - all we need are equal legal rights (marriage, adoption, etc.).
 
 You try to put everything in extremes - make everything black and white: Religion versus homosexuality. Sorry, but outside of your fantasyland, the real world doesn't work that way.

There are also numerous Christian groups and churches that support our rights as Homosexuals, and I know of at least three churches just in my city that willingly provide marriage ceremonies for gay couples (even though it isn't legally binding due to our state's rejection of our marriage rights).

 You both are the same - just opposite radical ends of the same coin.

If a person claiming to be a christian kicks their son out of the house for being gay, or beats a gay man are they christian? NO. They are like the Pharisees in Christ's time who were called out as hypocrites and bigots for not embracing the leper, the blind, the poor. Instead they took advantage of the poor and their sacrifices and being in allegiance with Rome, made a profit at the temple by saying the poor's offering was unclean and they had to buy one of their own as a sacrifise to god.
 
 What did jesus do? he kicked them all out of the temple! Jesus''s teachings were of love and compassion, and embracing your fellow man and loving them no matter who they were or their so called sin. Sadly most modern christians lose sight of this teaching.
 
 What I'm getting at matt is that not all of us being christians are bigots. I'mma big flaming queen with blond hair and tight jeans and flip flops, but I still love jesus and know he loves me for who I am.
 
 Am I going to use him as a scapegoat for political agenda? no. I'm not a modern day televangelist. But I do understand Christ's teachings and I do think religion, as tattered and fragmented as it may be, and although it is a main point in the suffering of gays, is a thing that must remain not only for its significance in the lives of everyday peoples and their hopes, dreams, and spiritual well being. But also as a means of connection, so that people of all faiths may find a common ground, and come together in peace and love one day to spread a message of love and tolerance. That is what I hope and pray one day may happen.
